fields.headline: Laws on trial
fields.bodyText: A number of the experimental law variations tested at semi-professional level in both hemispheres in the last couple of years will be adopted on a trial basis in next year's Super 14 series. But the SANZAR unions have shied away from adopting the most contentious of the variations, including players on their feet being able to play the ball in a ruck with their hands, legalising maul collapsing and ending the numbers rule in the lineout. The changes taken on include backlines having to stand five metres behind the feet of their No8 at a scrum and only offside and foul play offences meriting a kick at goal. Next summer's tours by European countries to the southern hemisphere will see the current laws apply.
